thread.title: Officials reach 'tentative' agreement in McHenry school strike
thread.title_full: Officials reach 'tentative' agreement in McHenry school strike - Chicago Tribune

author: Marwa Eltagouri
title: Officials reach 'tentative' agreement in McHenry school strike
text:
Union and school board negotiators at McHenry High School District 156, whose teachers have been on strike since Oct. 1, reached a preliminary agreement late Friday, a school board official said.
"We have reached a tentative agreement last night at midnight," said Gary Kinshofer, lead negotiator for the school board, in an email.
Union members will vote Monday to ratify the new contract, he said. If the contract is ratified, the strike would end. While Kinshofer wouldnâ€™t discuss the details of the negotiations, he confirmed the contract was a three-year deal.
The 152 educators on strike had been seeking raises of 1.36 percent for each of two years, plus annual step increases averaging 3.63 percent, union spokeswoman Heidie Dunn previously said.
Schools in the district remained closed for seven days during the strike, and all extracurricular activities for the 2,650 students, including sports and clubs, had been canceled.
Homecoming events scheduled for this weekend had been called off as well, though the homecoming dance will be rescheduled, the school district said on its website. Administrators plan to meet with student leadership groups as soon as school resumes so that they can provide input on revisions to the school calendar and rescheduling missed activities.
 Unions Educators
